Key Match Events: Abdullah Shafique scored the first century on World Cup debut in his fifth ODI match.
Mohammad Rizwan battled repeated cramps and scored 131 not out, guiding Pakistan to victory.
Hasan Ali took four wickets for 14 runs, bringing Pakistan back into the game after Sri Lanka looked poised for more than 344 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka's Kusal Mendis scored 122 runs, while Sadeera Samarawickrama scored 108 runs, but their efforts were in vain.
Pakistan's Babar Azam emphasized the team's focus on improving their powerplay performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Pakistan's win was a significant morale booster ahead of the World Cup.
Sri Lanka's loss in two consecutive games was a setback.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain interrupted play, reducing the game to 20 overs per side.
Sri Lanka recorded 344 runs, which was their highest score in the match.
